Service Branches

Army

As the oldest branch of the U.S. Military, founded in 1775, the Army defends the nation by land, sea and air.

The Army offers over 990,000 members 150 career opportunities across various disciplines, including aviation, information technology, health care, aircraft maintenance and Special Forces.

McKinney-Vento Homeless Education Assistance Improvement Act of 2001

This is a part of the McKinney-Vento Homeless Education Assistance Improvement Act of 2001.

Not cited if unable to produce Health & Immunization Records

A recent additional section to this Rule protects Child Care Centers from being cited If they are unable to produce health and immunization records for children that are homeless.

Refer child to local education agency liaison for Homeless Children and Youth

They are required to refer children experiencing homelessness that require extra assistance to the local education agency liaison for Homeless Children and Youth.
